msContents.summary: A Karaim translation of the Torah and the Haftarah

ab.title: Deuteronomy 4
ab.l: And now, oh Israel, listen to the statutesand to the judgments, which I teach you to do them, so thatyou may live, and you may come and inheritthe land which the Lord God of your fathers is giving you.
You shall not add to the word which I commandyou, and you shall not take away from it, in order to keep the commandmentsof the Lord your God which I command you.
It is your eyesthat saw what the Lord did at Baal-Peorand that every men who went after Baal-Peor:the Lord your God has destroyed them from among you.
But youwho were clinging to the Lord your God: you are alive,every one of you, today.
Look: I have taught you statutesand judgments as the Lord my God commanded me,that you should do so within the land to which you are comingto inherit it.
Keep therefore and do them, for this isyour wisdom and your reason in the sight of the peoples whichshall hear all these statutes and will say,“Only a wise and rational people is this great kingdom.”
Because who is a great kingdom that has the Providence of God so nearto them, as the Lord our God is, in all times of our callingto him?
And who is a great kingdom that has statutesand judgments so righteous as all this Law, which I setbefore you this day?

Only take heed to yourselfand watch your soul very much, lest you forget thethings that your eyes have seen, and lest they departfrom your reason, all the days of your life. But make them known to your sons,and to your sons’ sons.

The day that you stoodbefore the Lord your God in Horeb, when the Lord saidto me, “Gather the people to me, and I will make them hearmy words, that they may learnto fear me all the days that they shall liveon the earth, and that they may teach their children.”
And you came near and stood at the foot of the mountain,and the mountain burned with fire to the midst of heaven:darkness, clouds, and fog.
And the Lord spoketo you from the midst of the fire: You heard the voice of the words,but you saw no form, just sound.
And he told you his covenant,which he commanded you to do, the ten commandments, and he wrotethem on two tablets of stone.
And the Lord commanded me at that time to teach youstatutes and judgments, for you to do them in the landto which you are crossing to inherit it.
And take good heed to your souls — because you did not seeany image on the day that the Lord spoke to you in Horebfrom the midst of the fire —
Lest you corrupt your waysand make you a carved idol, a formof any image, a form of male orfemale,
A form of any animal thatis on the earth, a form of any winged bird that fliesin the skies,
A form of anything that creepson the ground, a form of any fish that is in the watersbeneath the earth,

And lest you lift upyour eyes to heaven and you see the sunand the moon and the stars, all the hostof heaven, and you go astray to worship them and servethem, because the Lord your God has apportioned them to all peoplesunder all the skies.
Butthe Lord has taken you, and he brought you out from the iron furnace,from Egypt, to be to him a people of share, as it is this day.
And the Lord was angry with me because of you, and heswore that I should not cross the Jordan, and that I should cometo that good land, which the Lord your God gives you for a share.
Because I will die in this land. I will not crossJordan. But you are crossing, and you will inherit that goodland.

Take heed to yourselves, lestyou will forget the covenant of the Lord your God that he madewith you and you will make a carved idol for yourself, of anyimage, which the Lord your God has commanded you not to do,
Because the Lord your God: he is like consuming fire, he is a jealousGod.

Because if you beget children and children’s childrenand grow old in the land, and if you corrupt your waysand make a carven idol, a form of anything,and if you do what is evil in the sight of the Lordyour God, to make him angry,

I will callheaven and earth to witness against you today,that you will utterly perish from off the land to which youyou are crossing the Jordan to inherit it. You will not prolongyour days on earth, but you will be utterly destroyed.
And the Lord will scatter you among the peoples, andyou will be left few in number among the kingdoms where the Lord will lead you.
And there you will serve those who servegods, the work of human hands, of wood andstone, that do not see or hear or eator smell.
But if from there you will beseechthe Lord your God, you will find his wishes,if you beseech him with all your heart and with all your soul,
And if all these words come on you when you are in tribulation,in the latter days, andif you return with repentance as far as to the Lord your God and obey his voice,
Because the Lord your God is a merciful God, he will not leaveyou and he will not destroy you and he will not forget thecovenant of your fathers which he swore to them.

Because ask,now, of the first days that were before you, from theday that God created man on the earth, andfrom the one edge of the skies to the edge of the skies: has there been|anything| like this great thing? Or has |anything| like it been heard?
Did ever people hear the voice of Godspeaking from the midst of the fire the way you have heard —and lived?

Or has God ever been used togoing and taking him a kingdom from the midst of another kingdomswith trials, with signs, and with tokens, and with war,and with a strong hand, and with an outstretched arm, andwith great fears, like all that the Lord your God did for youin Egypt in your sight?
You have been shownin order to know that the Lord: he is the God. There is no otherbesides him.
From the skies he had you hearhis voice in order to discipline you, and on the earthhe showed you his great fire, and you heard his wordsfrom the midst of the fire.
Andbecause he loved your fathers, he chosetheir offspring after them, and brought you outfrom great Egypt with his Providence,
To destroynations from before you greater and mightier than you are, to bring you in,to give you their land for a share,as it is this day.
Know therefore today, andrepeat it in your mind, that the Lord: he is the God in the skies aboveand on the earth beneath: there is none else.

And you shall keep therefore his statutes and his commandmentswhich I command you today, so it will be good for youand to your children after you, and that you may prolongyour days on the earth, which the Lord your God gives you,for all the days.’
Then Moses set apartthree cities at the ford of Jordan toward the sun’s rising,
That the manslayer might flee there, the one who would murder his neighbourwithout knowing — and he was not his enemyfor long; and he shall flee to one of these citiesand he shall live:
Bezerin the wilderness, in the plain country, of the tribe of Reuben,and Ramoth in Gilead, of the tribe of Gad,and Golan in Bashan, of the tribe of Manasseh.
And this is the Law which Moses setbefore the children of Israel.
These are thelaws and the statutes and the judgments which Moses spoketo the children of Israel, after they came out from the landof Egypt,

At the ford of Jordan, ina place called Gay opposite Beth-Peor,in the land of Sihon of the king of the Amorites who dweltat Heshbon, whom Moses and the children of Israel defeated,after they come out from the land of Egypt.
Andthey inherited his land, and the land of Og, kingof Bashan, the two kings of the Amorites, who were at the fordof Jordan toward the sun’s shining,
FromAroer, which is by the bank of the river Arnon, andas far as to Mount Sion, that is Hermon,
And all thesteppe, |from| the ford of Jordan eastward, and as far as to the seaof the steppe below the riverbeds of the summit.

app.note: A mistranslation based on interpreting Heb. בַּגַּיְא ‘in the valley’ as a place name.
A literal translation of Heb. הַפִּסְגָּה ‘of Pisgah’. | TKow.01: of the summit. | H: of the summit. | C: of the rock. | R: of the rock.
